newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - JULY 28.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - JULY 28.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- The situation in the Polish areas hit by floods is appalling, Hungarian civil defence flood protection specialists who spent in Poland for two weeks told the radio.
- The Hungarian Red Cross appealed to Hungarian transporters to help Hungarian aid shipments get to the Polish region hit by floods.
- Food prices will probably continue June's rising trend, analsysts said.
- The highest level of flood alert is likely to be introduced tomorrow along the river Fekete Koros (Crisul Negru) which crosses the border with Romania in the southeastern part of Hungary.

- Ruhrgas, the German minority owner of the Budapest gas distribution company Fogaz will aid with 125 million forints those families who became unable to afford paying the gas bill after recent price hikes.
- An investigation in the political past of more than 500 top officials, scheduled to end by July 31, will take at least further three months.
